member.summary: The Opc.Ua.Security.Certificates namespace defines classes which can be used to implement functions to create X509 certificates, to encode and decode X509 Certificate Revocation Lists (CRL), X509 Certificate Signing Requests (CSR) and related X509 extensions needed for the OPC UA certificate specification.

member.summary: Add an extension to the certificate in addition to the default extensions.
member.remarks: By default the following X509 extensions are added to a certificate, some depending on certificate type: CA/SubCA/OPC UA application: X509BasicConstraintsExtension X509SubjectKeyIdentifierExtension X509AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension X509KeyUsageExtension OPC UA application: X509SubjectAltNameExtension X509EnhancedKeyUsageExtension Adding a default extension to the list overrides the default value of the extensions. Adding an extension with a already existing Oid overrides the existing extension in the list.
member.param: The extension to add

member.summary: Determines whether the current thread holds this lock.
member.returns: true if the current thread holds this lock; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.EnterScope
member.summary: Enters the lock and returns a that may be disposed to exit the lock. Once the method returns, the calling thread would be the only thread that holds the lock.
member.returns: A that may be disposed to exit the lock.
member.remarks: If the lock cannot be entered immediately, the calling thread waits for the lock to be exited. If the lock is already held by the calling thread, the lock is entered again. The calling thread should exit the lock, such as by disposing the returned , as many times as it had entered the lock to fully exit the lock and allow other threads to enter the lock.

member.summary: A disposable structure that is returned by , which when disposed, exits the lock.

member.summary: A disposable structure that is returned by , which when disposed, exits the lock.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Lock.Scope.Dispose
member.summary: Exits the lock.
member.remarks: If the calling thread holds the lock multiple times, such as recursively, the lock is exited only once. The calling thread should ensure that each enter is matched with an exit.
member.exception: The calling thread does not hold the lock.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnscopedRefAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate a byref escapes and is not scoped.

remarks.para: There are several cases where the C# compiler treats a as implicitly - where the compiler does not allow the to escape the method.

For example:
for instance methods.
parameters that refer to types.
parameters.
This attribute is used in those instances where the should be allowed to escape.

Applying this attribute, in any form, has impact on consumers of the applicable API. It is necessary for API authors to understand the lifetime implications of applying this attribute and how it may impact their users.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ModuleInitializerAttribute
member.summary: Used to indicate to the compiler that a method should be called in its containing module's initializer.
member.remarks:
When one or more valid methods with this attribute are found in a compilation, the compiler will emit a module initializer which calls each of the attributed methods.
Certain requirements are imposed on any method targeted with this attribute: - The method must be `static`. - The method must be an ordinary member method, as opposed to a property accessor, constructor, local function, etc. - The method must be parameterless. - The method must return `void`. - The method must not be generic or be contained in a generic type. - The method's effective accessibility must be `internal` or `public`.
The specification for module initializers in the .NET runtime can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/blob/main/docs/design/specs/Ecma-335-Augments.md#module-initializer

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute
member.summary: Specifies the priority of a member in overload resolution. When unspecified, the default priority is 0.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The priority of the attributed member. Higher numbers are prioritized, lower numbers are deprioritized. 0 is the default if no attribute is present.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.OverloadResolutionPriorityAttribute.Priority
member.summary: The priority of the member.
